title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under Subpart XI of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program where student loans will be repaid in exchange for a 2-year full-time service at a healthcare facility in a scarcity area. Eligibility requires submitting an application. To participate in the Loan Repayment Program, individuals must submit an application and sign a written contract specified by the Secretary. Approval and acceptance by the Secretary are required for participation in the program. The Secretary gives preference to applicants with interdisciplinary studies training in awarding contracts under this section. The Secretary also determines frontline care scarcity areas for contract recipients, prioritizing areas with established programs. The Secretary prioritizes applicants with interdisciplinary studies training and frontline care scarcity areas for contract recipients under this section. The Secretary provides written notice to individuals upon approving their participation in the Loan Repayment Program. The Secretary offers student loan repayment to individuals who agree to provide frontline care services for a specified period. The student loan repayment program requires a 2-year full-time service at a health care facility in a frontline care scarcity area. Financial obligations are contingent on funds being appropriated, and breach of contract may result in damages to the United States. The Secretary determines the amount of annual student loan repayment under this section, considering the need to recruit health care providers. Payments are made directly to the loan provider. The Secretary may contract with an individual's loan provider for the payment of student loan repayments. If the individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid under the contract. The Secretary may contract with an individual's loan provider for student loan repayments. If the individual breaches the contract, the United States can recover the total amount paid. Definitions include 'frontline care scarcity area' and 'frontline care services' referring to designated areas with health professional shortages or lacking frontline care services. The term 'frontline care services' refers to health care services in various fields provided by specific healthcare professionals. Authorized healthcare professionals for frontline care services include audiologists, speech language pathologists, pharmacists, public health professionals, podiatric physicians, registered dieticians, occupational therapists, pediatricians, respiratory therapists, medical technologists, otolaryngologists, and radiologic technologists who have completed accredited education programs in the US. $78,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2010 for this purpose. For fiscal years 2010 to 2016, specific amounts were allocated annually for healthcare professional education. Starting from $78,000,000 in 2010, the funding increased by $15,000,000 each year, reaching $153,000,000 in 2015. From 2016 onwards, the budget would be adjusted based on the average percentage increase in health professions education costs from the previous year. The Secretary is responsible for implementing these provisions. The Secretary must start the loan repayment program within 180 days of the enactment of this section.
